text.0: how shall we pay oblation unto agni what hymn godloved is said to him refulgent.
text.1: who deathless true to law mid men a herald bringeth the gods as best of sacrificers.
text.2: bring him with reverence hither most propitious in sacrifices true to law the herald.
text.3: for agni when he seeks the gods for mortals knows them full well and worships them in spirit.
text.4: for he is mental power a man and perfect he is the bringer friendlike of the wondrous.
text.5: the pious Āryan tribes at sacrifices address them first to him who doeth marvels.
text.6: may agni foedestroyer manliest hero accept with love our hymns and our devotion.
text.7: so may the liberal lords whose strength is strongest urged by their riches stir our thoughts with vigour.
text.8: thus agni jātavedas true to order hath by the priestly gotamas been lauded.
text.9: may he augment in them splendour and vigour observant as he lists he gathers increase.
